body_html:
Note that to call cublasGemmEx, one needs to enable autotune for matmul, which can be done by setting this environment var:
export TF_MATMUL_AUTOTUNE_ENABLE = 1
By default the autotune for matmul is disabled,

So first you can try turning on the autotune for matmul.

@reedwm For your question, I think the computation_type is the param that is sent in. I do not see any possibility that it failed to get sent to cublas. I'd set it with:
os.environ['TF_FP16_MATMUL_USE_FP32_COMPUTE']='1'
in python just to make sure it gets set.
body_text:
Note that to call cublasGemmEx, one needs to enable autotune for matmul, which can be done by setting this environment var:
export TF_MATMUL_AUTOTUNE_ENABLE = 1
By default the autotune for matmul is disabled,
So first you can try turning on the autotune for matmul.
@reedwm For your question, I think the computation_type is the param that is sent in. I do not see any possibility that it failed to get sent to cublas. I'd set it with:
os.environ['TF_FP16_MATMUL_USE_FP32_COMPUTE']='1'
in python just to make sure it gets set.
body:
Note that to call cublasGemmEx, one needs to enable autotune for matmul, which can be done by setting this environment var:
`export TF_MATMUL_AUTOTUNE_ENABLE = 1`
By default the autotune for matmul is disabled, 

So first you can try turning on the autotune for matmul.

@reedwm For your question, I think the computation_type is the param that is sent in. I do not see any possibility that it failed to get sent to cublas. I'd set it with:
`os.environ['TF_FP16_MATMUL_USE_FP32_COMPUTE']='1'`
in python just to make sure it gets set.
